intro: Odontophyllum juninensis, commonly known as the Junín orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with a distinctive coloration. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its morphology includes slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to its specialized habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat vulnerability, it is considered a conservation concern.
